w:r.w:t: Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) Platform
Full Functional Specification & User Stories (Beta Build)

This document is the authoritative, build-ready functional specification for a world-class EPR software platform. It defines WHAT must be built, HOW users interact with it, and HOW visual (Sankey) and traditional (form/table) workflows coexist. It is intended to be handed directly to a development team to build a production-quality beta.
1. Core Design Principles
Dual-modality UX: every modelling step is accessible via a visual Sankey-style builder and via traditional form/table interfaces.
Immediate explainability: every number shown in the UI must be traceable back to raw inputs and formulas.
Jurisdiction-first logic: regulations, fees, and reporting rules are jurisdiction-driven and versioned.
Progressive completeness: users can start anywhere; the system clearly flags missing data blocking analysis.
Single source of truth: one canonical data model drives visuals, tables, calculations, and exports.
2. Global Navigation & Layout
Home screen provides access to all phases of the EPR lifecycle:
Packaging Raw Materials
Packaging Types & Units
Products (SKUs)
Distribution
Recycling
Analysis
Settings & Schemes
Global controls (persistent across all screens): Scenario selector, Effective date selector, Jurisdiction filter, Toggle: Visual Builder / Form & Tables / Split View.
3. Dual Interface Model (MANDATORY)
3.1 Visual Sankey Builder Interface
The Visual Builder is a drag-and-drop, Sankey-style canvas that allows users to model, connect, and understand the full packaging → product → distribution → cost flow visually.
Visual Builder capabilities:
Palette of entities: Raw Materials, Material Classifications, Packaging Types, Packaging Units, Products (SKUs), Geographies, Jurisdictions, Fee Schemes.
Drag entities onto canvas as nodes.
Connect nodes with edges to define relationships (validated against data model).
Branching flows supported; Geography nodes always roll up to Jurisdiction.
Metric mode selector controls link thickness: weight, EPR fee, eco-modulation fee, PRN, plastics tax, total tax, packaging cost, packaging cost + tax.
Time and scenario aware: canvas updates when scenario or effective date changes.
Clicking any node or link opens an 'Explain this' side panel showing underlying records and calculations.
3.2 Traditional Form & Table Interface
Every data domain must also be manageable via structured forms and tables. This is essential for power users, bulk editing, uploads, and audit confidence.
Form/Table interface requirements:
CRUD forms for every entity (materials, types, units, products, fees, etc.).
Spreadsheet-style editable tables with validation and inline warnings.
Bulk upload/download via XLSX/CSV for all major entities.
Real-time indicators showing how form changes affect the visual builder.
Users can toggle between Visual Builder, Forms/Tables, or view both side-by-side at any time. Both interfaces operate on the same underlying data.
4. Functional Specification by Phase
4A. Packaging Raw Materials
Define raw materials with hierarchical classifications (e.g. Glass → Coloured → Green).
Associate classifications with jurisdictions that recognise them.
Define EPR base fees per classification, per jurisdiction, per time period.
Define eco-modulation fees per geography (nested in jurisdiction).
Version all fees with effective dates, reference documents, reporting rules, and approval workflow.
Visual Builder usage: Users can visually connect Raw Materials → Jurisdictions to immediately see where fees apply and where gaps exist.
4B. Packaging Types & Units
Packaging Types represent individual components and link to a material classification.
Packaging Units are collections of Packaging Types (primary → quaternary).
Packaging Types store physical attributes and packaging cost per component.
Packaging Units automatically calculate total weight and packaging cost.
Visual Builder usage: Users assemble Packaging Units by visually grouping Packaging Types; weight and cost flows update in real time.
4C. Products (SKUs)
Products represent sellable SKUs.
Each SKU must be associated with one or more Packaging Units.
Optional landed cost per SKU (manual in Phase 1; ERP in Phase 2).
Visual Builder usage: Connect Packaging Units → SKUs to validate completeness.
4D. Distribution
Capture quantities of SKUs placed on the market by geography and date.
Geographies are always nested within exactly one jurisdiction.
Distribution drives which fee schemes apply.
Visual Builder usage: Connect SKUs → Geographies → Jurisdictions to visualise market placement.
4E. Recycling
Define recyclability percentages per material classification and geography.
Used to calculate eco-modulation bonuses or penalties.
Versionable assumptions and data sources.
4F. Analysis & Outputs
Calculate EPR, eco-modulation, PRN, and plastics tax in parallel.
Produce totals by SKU, geography, jurisdiction, and scheme.
Support scenario comparison and delta analysis.
Export regulator-ready reports and evidence packs.
Visual Builder usage: Default Sankey blueprints provide immediate insights; users can build custom flows for explanation and consulting.
5. Core User Stories
Consultant – Visual Explanation
As a packaging consultant, I want to visually show how materials, packaging, SKUs, and jurisdictions drive EPR cost so clients immediately understand cost drivers.
Acceptance criteria:
I can switch to the Sankey builder at any time.
Link thickness reflects selected metric.
I can click any flow and see exact calculations.
Compliance Manager – Accuracy & Audit
As a compliance manager, I want structured tables, versioned fees, and locked calculations so submissions are defensible.
Acceptance criteria:
All fees are versioned with approval workflow.
Calculation snapshots are immutable.
Exports match regulator formats.
Sustainability Team – Scenario Modelling
As a sustainability lead, I want to compare packaging scenarios and see cost and recyclability impact.
Acceptance criteria:
I can clone a scenario and change packaging.
Delta views show increase/decrease clearly.
Visual and table views stay in sync.
Packaging Company – Cost Control
As a packaging supplier, I want to see packaging cost + tax together so I can optimise designs.
Acceptance criteria:
Packaging cost per component is visible.
Total economic impact is clear per SKU.
6. Beta Success Criteria
A new user can model a full product → jurisdiction flow in under 30 minutes.
All default Sankey blueprints render correctly with sample data.
Visual and table interfaces remain perfectly consistent.
Users can explain any number shown in under 3 clicks.
